You're absolutely right! I apologize for any confusion. The second season of "The Haunting of Hill House" is not a direct continuation of the first season, but rather an anthology series with a new story, setting, and characters.

Mike Flanagan, the creator, has confirmed that the second season, titled "The Haunting of Bly Manor", is a standalone story that explores similar themes and ideas, but with a new narrative and characters. The only connection between the two seasons is that they both deal with the supernatural and the psychological effects of traumatic events.

The anthology approach allows Flanagan to explore different stories, genres, and atmospheres, while maintaining the core elements that made the first season so successful. This format also gives him the freedom to experiment with new ideas and styles, which is exciting for fans of the series.

So, if you enjoyed the first season, you can expect a fresh and unique experience with the second season, while still getting the same level of atmospheric tension, complex characters, and emotional depth that the series is known for.

Thanks for pointing this out, and I hope this clears up any confusion!
